name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

strengths: Shift allows type manipulation for weakness exploitation
Free retreat cost provides excellent mobility
Venom Powder can inflict both Confusion and Poison
Can become any type except Colorless
weaknesses: Venom Powder only does 10 base damage
Shift is disabled by status conditions
counters: Fire Pokemon - double damage from weakness
Status condition inflicting attacks - disable Shift
High HP Pokemon - 10 damage is negligible

competitiveHistory: Venomoth from Jungle was a niche card that saw occasional play due to its unique Shift Pokemon Power. The ability to change types allowed for creative plays exploiting weakness, but the low damage output of Venom Powder limited its practical applications. The free retreat cost was appreciated, but Venomoth was generally outclassed by more straightforward attackers. It remained a curiosity rather than a competitive staple.

rulings.ruling: Shift changes Venomoth's type until the end of the turn or until Shift is used again. The type reverts at the end of the turn.
Venomoth can change to the type of any Pokemon in play (including benched Pokemon and opponent's Pokemon), except it cannot become Colorless type.
If there are no non-Colorless Pokemon in play other than Venomoth, Shift cannot be used.
Venom Powder's Confused and Poisoned effects both apply on a successful coin flip.
